title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Israel and Hamas reach initial ceasefire deal. And, National Guard arrive near Chicago

items.title: Renewable energy outpaces coal for electricity generation in historic first, report says
items.description: For the first time on record, renewable energy generated more electricity for the planet than coal, a new report says.

items.title: Need a laptop? This retiree refurbishes laptops, gives them away to those in need
items.description: Craig Clark, 79, calls himself the "Tech Fairy." Clark spends his time refurbishing old laptops and giving them away for free to people who need them.

items.title: Pope Leo says faith and love for migrants are connected
items.description: In his first major document as leader of the Catholic Church, Pope Leo urges nations and believers to care for the poorest in society.

items.title: In Utah, a group that helped prompt the redistricting says it's acting on faith
items.description: Mormon Women for Ethical Government was one of the plaintiffs in a lawsuit that could overturn Utah's Republican-leaning map for U.S. House seats. Tha...

items.title: Federal court to weigh Trump’s deployment of National Guard troops in Chicago area

items.title: Library director fired amid book dispute wins $700,000 settlement
items.description: Terri Lesley was fired amid an uproar over books ​with sexual content and LGBTQ+ themes that some people complained were inappropriate for youngsters.

items.title: In Epstein's cell, a scene of disarray without thorough inspection
items.description: Photos of Jeffrey Epstein's cell show a scene of disarray that never underwent a proper inspection, according to experts.

items.title: Israel and Hamas agree first phase of Gaza peace plan
items.description: The deal raises hopes for a lasting peace after more than two years of conflict.

items.title: Fireworks and a toast to life: Israelis delight at deal to return hostages
items.description: "I can't quite believe this is actually happening, we've been waiting for so long," said Gil Dickman, cousin of hostage Carmel Gat.

items.title: Lyse Doucet: Gaza deal is a huge moment but this is just the beginning
items.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet reflects on how long-awaited negotiations to move forward, not further back, appear to be succeeding.

items.title: China restricts export of metals vital for making electronics
items.description: Beijing's monopoly over rare earths is a key bargaining chip in its trade negotiations with the US.
